habitat_description:
This species is fund from New Jersey to southern Florida. Its range also includes Kansas, Texas, northeastern Mexico, southern Illinois, southern Indiana and Ohio, and also south to the Gulf Coast (Brooks 1975; Conant and Collins 1991).

The wide variety of habitats occupied by the little brown skink include: various types of forest, cropland, hedgerow, woodland, orchards, and various suburban habitats. This species is commonly found in areas with ground cover (grass, leaf litter, rocks, etc.), and also near stream and pond edges (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999).

GP	 - Various woodland types and forests. Restricted to pond and stream edges in this region.
SE	- Found in association with ground cover as grass, leaf litter, rocks, and forest floor debris.
